examples.text: a 54-year-old woman
an interesting young woman
married/single women
men, women and children
a women's group/movement
I prefer to see a woman doctor.
women in business
Older women often feel invisible.
She is a role model for other women.
The freedom to wear trousers became a symbol of women's liberation.
She plays for the women's team.
The little girl she remembered was now a grown woman.
There were important changes in the position of women in society.
We want to change the way women are depicted in the media.
Women were limited to the more poorly paid jobs.
Why should women be reduced to playing a passive role?
a United Nations report on violence against women
a professor of women's studies
Both men and women should have access to paid parental leave.
The drug carries a warning against use by pregnant women.
There are many professional opportunities for young women today.
Two well-dressed women were sitting at the next table.
Our mother was a very beautiful woman.
She worked for women's rights.
She's all woman! *(= has qualities that are typical of women)*

definitions.definition: a woman who comes from the place mentioned or whose job or interest is connected with the thing mentioned

examples.text: an Englishwoman
a businesswoman
a Congresswoman
a horsewoman

definitions.definition: a female worker, especially one who works with her hands

examples.text: We used to have a woman to do the cleaning.

definitions.definition: a rude way of addressing a female person, especially when telling her what to do

examples.text: Be quiet, woman!

definitions.definition: a person's wife, girlfriend or female partner

examples.text: He's got a new woman in his life.

definitions.definition: to act or think independently, not following others or being ordered

examples.text: Working for herself meant that she could be her own woman.

definitions.definition: used to refer to somebody, usually a woman, who has reacted very angrily to something, especially the fact that her husband or partner has been unfaithful
with a lot of force or energy

examples.text: She flew out of the room like a woman possessed.

definitions.definition: to marry a woman after having had a sexual relationship with her, especially if she is pregnant
a man/woman who likes the same things or has the same opinions as you
an average or ordinary person, either male or female

examples.text: Politicians often don't understand the views of the man in the street.
What really matters to the man and woman in the street?

definitions.definition: a man/woman who understands and supports ordinary people

examples.text: She wanted to seem like a woman of the people.

definitions.definition: a rich and powerful man or woman
a person with a lot of experience of life, who is not easily surprised or shocked

wordOrigin: Old English wīfmon, -man (see wife, man), a formation peculiar to English, the ancient word being wife.
